review_title: The system is bad but the work is good.
pros: The work is mostly in service to your fellow students, staff, and faculty, which means its both interconnected, fun, and useful to the people around you. As a job it both makes sure to not be too taxing while keeping a friendly and positive work environment.
cons: The staffing issues mean that work will be consistently understaffed, which leaves a positive work environment feeling strained at its very core. It is not uncommon to see people working what should be a multiple person job alone.

review_title: Decent University to Work / Best Talent Has High Turnover
pros: They're trying to take the University in the right direction with investing in some areas where other colleges aren't at the moment. The majority of faculty and staff are fairly friendly and provide good guidance on one's position and/or you can usually build out your position accordingly working with others.
cons: Geographically it's winter seven months of the year and it's in the snow belt, meaning it gets over 180+ inches of snow annually and is gray seven months of the year. If you enjoy the gloom and trudging through snow constantly and being cold, SUNY Oswego is for you. Also, the best talent, i.e. younger staff or professors, come and go very quickly. It's a desolate rust-belt town with very little to do not near any good nightlife. The lake is pretty for the two months it's summer (so it'll seem) but there's not a lot to do around there. And because all the best and brightest leave most the remaining people are the ones lacking in talent to make it elsewhere.

pros: Not bad hours got paid
cons: It was mismanaged and unorganized

review_title: SUNY Oswego - A Diamond in the Rough
job_title: Chief Technology Officer in Oswego, NY
pros: There are many opportunities to make substantial and positive contributions to the institution.  The campus is growing both in student population and facilities.  About $300 million will be invested in new facilities and facilities refurbishment over the next several years.  This will help establish the university as a truly world class institution.  There are some exciting opportunities available to creative and enthusiastic individuals who wish to have a positive impact on the education of young people.
cons: It is a little isolated from main stream culture and significant services.  The weather in the winter can be a little difficult to handle.  There is still a strong "old school" culture among many of the faculty and staff who have dedicated their careers to the university.  Often this can be an asset, but it can also be a barrier to progress.

job_title: Computer Lab Monitor in Oswego, NY
pros:
Hours are great.
Allows you to meet new people on campus.
Watch movies, listen to music, or do your course work during your shift(s).
Salary isn't that bad either.
cons: Some of the students are pretty annoying and don't exactly respect you as the monitor of the lab. This is especially obnoxious when you are staying over your shift so someone else can complete work. People never sign in... If it's too difficult for you to simply put your name on a piece of paper at this time in your life, then you have a long way to go my friend.

pros: Beautiful location with some dorms literally on Lake Ontario. Low stress town...
cons: Most of the administration here are bureaucratic and intellecticual lightweights. Literally championing mediocrity and proud of it sadly. This is the their special island since the college student body sort of mirrors them (they could never get into Bingo or Geneseo...probably not even New Paltz). Most of the administration is brain dead and local..which also means pretty backwards. Also quite entitled since SUNY is one of the safest places to work in this part of NY that resembles some the red-neckiest of NY. Nepotism here is rampant. Check out the educational backgrounds of most of these people...you aren't any Ivy or even Colgates here. SUNY Potsdam, SUNY IT, SUNY Plattsburgh seems to be the high end.

review_title: A satisfying, school-work friendly job for a college student
pros: It's convenient to work on campus and the staff is excellent. You never lack for friends or resources because the network is awesome. Hours are also scheduled around tests, and it's not difficult to switch shifts if an emergency comes up.
cons: The number of hours you can work is limited, which limits your paycheck as well unless you pick up more than one job. Then it gets tricky to schedule.

pros: Generally easy work. An average day consist of cleaning windows, taking out and replacing garbage, mopping and sweeping, and cleaning surfaces with disinfectant. Consistent schedule and one of the only places in this small town that can offer that.
cons: The state workers treat the students like slaves as if we are in punishment for all the work they have to do because of us throughout the academic year. Most higher-ups do absolutely nothing. They talk to people in offices and check on the students every 5 seconds.

job_title: English As A Second Language Instructor in Oswego, NY
pros: Like I said, this is the best place I ever worked.  I never would've left if I hadn't moved.  The management was supportive and encouraging.  They don't micromanage at all.  They invite your ideas and give you the freedom to bring out your best talents.
cons: There's a whole lot of snow up around Lake Oswego.  Be prepared for some harsh winters.  Obviously, the pay could always be better.  Even other SUNY schools offered better compensation.  Still, I'd much rather take lower pay at Oswego than higher pay somewhere else.

review_title: It was a good experience, paid for half my classes and I made a lot of connections
job_title: SUNY Oswego Graduate Assistant in Oswego, NY
pros:
Pays for half of your tuition
Free employee parking pass
Good to have on resume
Make a lot of connections
cons: You have to work eighteen to twenty hours a week - this is very hard if you are taking alot of classes

review_title: Great Place to Work as a College Student
pros: I loved working as a desk attendant at SUNY Oswego, in the department of Residence Life and Housing. The hours were flexible, the pay was good for the amount of work we did, and I was still able to maintain my grades while working at this job. I loved it here and miss it!
cons: The only con I would say is working the 12-3 am shifts. Not many students came during this time, and I think if they changed the hours to at the latest 1 a.m., desk attendants would be happier with this choice.

pros: The campus is incredible and they have so many fantastic programs for the students. There's opportunity for growth and the school as a whole is heading in the right direction.
cons: They're stretched pretty thin due to the fact that they try to do everything but don't have the budget, staffing, or ability to accomplish their goals. The fail to hire enough professors/offer enough classes and it causes many of the students to stay an additional year or more and it just goes to show that their focus is on bringing in more money and running a business.

pros: It is a great opportunity to learn while learning. Working on campus also is a great way to network and uncover people who can help in the job force beyond graduation. Who doesn't like getting paid while learning anyway?
cons: The wages are low because it is a sate funded organization. Sometimes work can get in the way of school work but other than that everything is grand.

job_title: Front Desk Attendant in Oswego, NY
pros: Allows me to create a rapport with many different students and faculty members.  This position has also taught me how to remain organized in stressful situations.
cons: Sometimes there is not much work to be done as a desk attendant, which can make for a slow and uneventful shift.

review_title: Great place to work for the summer if you're an undergraduate
pros: More than minimum wage at starting at $9 to $10 an hour and the work isn't to stressful. You'll have a supervisor that watches over what you do but normally you'll be working by yourself.
cons: Cleaning stuff can get boring especially when its an 8 hour shift.

pros: The tutoring center is a positive environment to work in.  You are surrounded by your peers and have many references available by the Office of Learning Services.
cons: No real cons--sometimes the sign in/out system will have some glitches but they usually do not affect payroll.  Tutortrac is the website that is used.

pros: Great staff- most of the art department is always willing to help. Cynthia Clabough is extremely helpful,  dedicated, and always goes above and beyond for the students. The graphic design department and the art department are so wonderful and filled with professors who really care and want students to succeed
cons: Winters are cold, sometimes it's difficult to agree with administration, I wish there were more chances to take classes out of major.

review_title: Fantastic experience that taught me to manage a department and allowed me contribute new ideas to the overall college.

pros: Great colleagues to work with, supportive supervisors, ability to help in other areas to expand personal skills and knowledge, excellent campus events, great benefits
cons: Limited to four years of service as an RHD due to not being a permanent appointment position.

pros: Some good students, nice campus, friendly colleagues, lower Summer expectations
cons: Stuck in the past, little support for innovation, older faculty have power to prevent new faculty from improving on any methods.

review_title: Very supportive community to work in - LOVE IT.
pros: No matter what I need to perform my teaching or research duties, my chair and my dean make sure that I get it. My colleagues are professional and supportive of each other. Very positive work atmosphere.
cons: None other than the drive in winters.

pros: Big environment. Networking opportunities. Interact with large student community. Paid training. Easy to find a work life balance. Office hours usually end between 4 and 5 pm campus wide. Free food every one in a while.
cons: Not easy to get promoted. No paid time off for student workers.

pros: Great people to work with. Many opportunities to learn and grow. Flexible schedules. Students keep us young!
cons: Weather on campus can be brutal in winter, but grounds crew does a nice job of keeping roads clear. Beautiful campus to walk during summer, spring, and fall.

pros: Supportive administration that keeps student learning and growth at the forefront. Leadership treats faculty and staff with respect. Well defined and forward-thinking strategic plan.
cons: The town of Oswego could stand some revitalization, but the college itself is wonderful.
